task: The user has been unable to send MMS messages using their messaging app for the past few hours. Customer name: John Smith, phone number: 555-123-2002, current location: at home in the United States. They will consider the issue resolved when an MMS message can be successfully sent.

messages.content: Hi there. I’m having trouble sending those picture messages… I think they’re called “MMS”? Every time I try to send one using my phone’s messages app, it just won’t go through. Could you help me fix this? I’m not very good with these things.

I can help you get picture messages (MMS) working. First, I need to identify your account so I can check the correct line.

Please provide one of the following:
- The phone number on the line with the issue, or
- Your full name and date of birth (YYYY-MM-DD), or
- Your customer ID

While you grab that, a couple of quick questions:
- Are you connected to Wi‑Fi right now? MMS usually needs mobile data turned on to work.
- Can you make regular calls or send plain text messages from this phone?

Once I have your account details, I’ll walk you through a few simple checks and fix steps.
messages.reasoning_content: User reports MMS not sending. Plan: identify customer and line, then guided tech diagnostics. Ask for account verification (phone number or name+DOB) and confirm they’re not trying over Wi-Fi Calling. After lookup, check prerequisites: cellular service, mobile data working, network not 2G, APN/MMSC correct, messaging app permissions. Use check_status_bar, check_network_status, check_sim_status, run_speed_test, can_send_mms, check_network_mode_preference, check_apn_settings, check_wifi_calling_status, check_app_permissions. Apply fixes: toggle_airplane_mode if on, reseat_sim if missing, reset APN if incorrect, toggle_data if off, toggle_roaming if abroad, toggle_wifi_calling if on, grant permissions if missing, reboot after APN changes. Keep language simple and step-by-step.

messages.content:
My name is John Smith, and my phone number is 555-123-2002.

I’m at home right now, so I think the phone is connected to Wi-Fi, but I’m not sure how to check. I am able to call and text normally—just not send those picture messages.

Is that enough information, or do you need something else? And how do I check if my mobile data is turned on?

Thanks, John. I can look you up by your phone number. For security, I just need your date of birth in YYYY-MM-DD format to complete the verification.

In the meantime, let’s do a couple of quick checks on your phone that don’t require anything technical:
- Turn mobile data on: This is often the main reason MMS won’t go through when on Wi‑Fi.
  - On most phones: Open Settings > Network & Internet > Mobile network > and make sure Mobile data is ON.
  - If you don’t see those exact words, look for a toggle labeled Mobile data or Cellular data in your settings or pull down the quick settings panel from the top of your screen and tap the Mobile data icon.
- Check Wi‑Fi Calling: Sometimes having Wi‑Fi Calling on can interfere with MMS.
  - Open Settings > Network & Internet > Mobile network > Advanced (or Calls) > Wi‑Fi Calling, and turn it OFF temporarily to see if that helps.
- Restart the messaging app: Fully close your Messages app and reopen it, then try sending a small picture again.

Please send your date of birth so I can verify your account and continue with guided checks if needed.
messages.reasoning_content: Request DOB for verification, then look up customer by phone. After verification, guide through step-by-step MMS diagnostics including toggling mobile data, checking Wi‑Fi, APN, network mode, Wi‑Fi Calling, and permissions. Keep instructions simple.

messages.content:
My date of birth is 1959-08-15.

Sorry, I get very nervous when you mention “settings” and all those menus… I really don’t know where everything is. If I try to turn things off or on, will I lose my photos or anything important? I’m very worried about messing something up.

Could you guide me step-by-step, one thing at a time? And is it safe to do these checks?

messages.reasoning_content: User provided name and DOB. Next: identify customer via phone number lookup, then retrieve customer details to get line info. Then start step-by-step diagnostics for MMS, reassuring user about safety and that toggles won’t affect photos. Ask user consent to run simple checks and make step-by-step instructions, possibly asking them to perform actions we can guide via prompts.

messages.content:
Thanks for the details, John. I looked up the account for phone number 555-123-2002. I found a John Smith, but the date of birth on the account doesn’t match the one you provided. For your security, I can’t proceed with account-specific steps until we verify your identity.

Could you please double-check your date of birth? If the date I have is incorrect, you can also confirm using:
- Your customer ID (if you have it), or
- Your full name and your service address

About your worry: It’s completely safe to do the checks I’ll guide you through, and you will not lose your photos or any important information by toggling settings like mobile data or Wi‑Fi Calling. These are like flipping simple switches—they don’t delete anything.

Once we verify your identity, I’ll guide you step-by-step, one thing at a time, in plain language.
messages.reasoning_content: Account found by phone, but the DOB provided by user (1959-08-15) doesn’t match account DOB (1985-06-15). For security, I must not proceed with account-specific changes yet. I should inform the user of the mismatch, ask them to recheck DOB, and optionally provide another identifier (customer ID or confirm full name and address). Meanwhile, reassure about safety of steps and offer to guide with very simple, one-at-a-time checks after verification.

messages.content:
Oh dear, I thought I had it right. I’m John Smith, and my phone number is 555-123-2002. My service address should be 233 Maple Street, Springfield, IL.

I don’t think I have a customer ID handy, but I hope my full name, phone number, and address will do. Can you check with that?

And thank you for reassuring me—I just get flustered easily!

messages.reasoning_content: Attempt to verify identity using name and DOB to find a matching John Smith; if none matches, verify by address or escalate to human agent.

function.name: transfer_to_human_agents
function.arguments: {"summary": "Customer John Smith with phone number 555-123-2002 reports inability to send MMS. Lookup by phone returns a different DOB (1985-06-15) than customer\u2019s provided (1959-08-15). Search by name/DOB returned no matches. Customer provided service address as 233 Maple Street, Springfield, IL to verify identity. Unable to verify identity via available tools. Needs identity verification before proceeding with MMS troubleshooting (mobile data enable, Wi\u2011Fi Calling toggle, APN/MMS checks). Please assist with account verification and continue MMS troubleshooting guidance."}

messages.reasoning_content: We cannot verify the user with the provided name/DOB or phone number (DOB mismatch). Address alone isn’t sufficient in tools. Best next step: transfer to human agent for identity verification, then continue MMS troubleshooting.

messages.content: YOU ARE BEING TRANSFERRED TO A HUMAN AGENT. PLEASE HOLD ON.
messages.reasoning_content: Identity could not be verified with provided name+DOB and phone number. Transfer to a human agent is appropriate; provide the transfer message as required.
